abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Programmatic Fiscal
            Reform Loan - Social Security Reform project for Brazil were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: Pension
            reform is a complex technical and political process which
            needs a strong local ownership as well as appropriate
            respect of outsiders to the country's political
            sensitivities. Over the last decade of World Bank
            involvement in Brazil's pension policy dialogue the
            Government requested technical support but asked the Bank to
            maintain a discrete public role. The Bank has done this
            during the preparation of this loan and the elaboration of
            the Economic and Sector Work (ESW) prepared on the
            Government's request.Follow-up pension reforms may not
            take place within the expected timeframe due to political
            resistance. The second reform in the program is still under
            discussion in the Government but may not take place during
            this administration. The Bank must be prepared to accept
            this reality.
